If you forgot your password, click on the Request a New Password link and a new, temporary password will be sent to your email address.
The Basic Laboratory Information System (BLIS) tracks patient specimens and laboratory results.
You can update your profile and password by clicking on Edit Profile.
This page allows us to register new patients or lookup existing patients based on name, patient ID or number.
Once a patient has been registered, we can use this page to view,edit the patients profile.
To register a new specimen, enter Patient by ID/Name or add a new Patient first.
Patient ID, Name and Gender are mandatory fields.
You can move to the next field by pressing Tab key or clicking on it using the mouse.
Only one of Age or Date of Birth is required for entry.
Are you sure you want to remove this specimen form?
Please select or add a patient first.
Are you sure you want to abort this registration?
Please select a specimen type to see the tests for that specimen.
To add more than one specimen click on Add Another Specimen option.
No related tests for this specimen
All results submitted for this patient
You can use this page to search for registered patients. Enter a partial name to generate a list of patients containing the string.
Once you select the patient, you can view the patient's profile, look up the tests he has undergone and the results of those tests.
Search for a Specimen by ID or Patients by ID/Name
Please enter either Age or Date of Birth
No registered tests found for this specimen
Verify results for this specimen and make corrections if any
Enter results for this specimen and make corrections to already existing results if any
Note: Custom fields can be added after the lab has been configured, using Manage lab configuration option.
Please review and confirm all settings and click on Add to create lab configuration.
Please wait while the system creates lab configuration. This may take a few minutes.
Gives a summary of lab setup including the lab personnel accounts, test and specimen types.

In case of system failure, if we want to revert to a previously backedup copy of the data we can use this option. You can choose to backup current version before doing this. You may also choose to include to revert back the language settings.
Specimen / Test Types - This option allows us to configure the Specimens can be collected and Tests that are performed at the particular lab.
Target TAT - This option list the turnaround time for each test type. We can modify the TAT using the Edit option and changing the value.
Result Interpretation - This option allows us to specify the interpretation for multiple ranges of values for each test type.
This page gives a summary of the various users given access to the system.
It also allows for creation of new user accounts.
It allows to edit account settings, delete accounts and monitor account activity.
This page allows for the configuration of the patient registration page. It allows for creating mandatory fields and hides certain fields if they are not desired to be filled.
It also allows for creation of certain custom fields for Patient registration and new Specimen addition which may be needed by certain labs only.
This is an editable page for setting the various parameters associaated with each individual test type.
This is an editable page for setting the layout of the Patient Report, Daily log of Specimens and Daily log of Patients.
This is an editable page for creating custom worksheets.
Are you sure you want to delete this lab configuration? All data and technician accounts will be deleted permanently.
Edit user account details or reset password by entering a new one.
Backup reverted successfully. Please shutdown the system and restart to complete the reverting process.
You will now be able to access BLIS by clicking on BlisSetup.html and entering your username and password.
In case of a computer restart or network failure click on Setup Network option again.
Enable/Disable test report generation in this lab
Configure the different fields in a test report
Add/Remove specimen collection sites to the laboratory records
Enable Site Entry for a Specimen
To edit technician accounts, use Manage option in Lab Configurations page.
Lab Configurations exist under this admin account. Please delete or re-assign them before deleting this account.
You can add, remove or modify specimen types, test types and valid ranges on this page.
No Test Types found in Catalog
No Specimen Types found in Catalog
Sure to remove catalog data? All specimen/test types will be deleted and would have to be entered again.
Error: No measures selected for this test type
Only numbers and alphabets should be used while adding measures.For the range option please specify the lower and the upper bound.
Gives a complete listing of the available test types.
Use this page to edit existing test types.
You can also add new Test types using the 'Add New' option located near the top of the Page.
Gives a complete listing of the available specimen types.
We can use this page to edit existing specimen types. Tests compatible with a particular specimen type can added/deleted by checking the appropriate boxes located here.
You can also add new Specimen types using the 'Add New' option located near the top of the Page.
Select Site and Patient ID to print Patient Test History.
Select Specimen to view Report of all tests done on it
Select Site, Test Type, Date Interval and Fields to print Test Records.
Select Site and Test Type to view tests pending at the site.
Print all records handled on a given day.
Select facility and date range to view infection graph and prevalence rates.
Select Site and Date Interval to view number of Specimens or Tests Handled over the specified duration.
Select Site and Date Interval to view average test-wise Turn around Times over the specified duration.
Select tests to generate age and gender-wise Infection Report.
No new tests registered on this date.
No new patients registered on this date.
Error: No alphanumeric value tests found
No test entries found for the given date range.
No specimens pending in the supplied date interval.
Specimens pending in the supplied date interval.
ERROR: Infection Report not configured for this facility. Please contact lab manager.
Selected specimens belong to different patients. Please try again.
Click on column heading to sort the table by that field.
Please note that passwords are case-sensitive.
Error: Old password did not match
Add the details of the stock in the given form. To add more that one stock items you can select Add Another.
Enter the quantity of the stock being checked out. The table below gives account of the current inventory.
This page allows to toggle between languages. It also allows you to change the content being displayed.
You can also choose to change the language for a few pages using this option. The pages are listed as a drop-down menu.
Gives a summary of lab setup including the lab personnel accounts, test and specimen types.
Specimen / Test Types - This option allows us to configure the Specimens can be collected and Tests that are performed at the particular lab.
Target TAT - This option list the turnaround time for each test type. We can modify the TAT using the Edit option and changing the value.
Result Interpretation - This option allows us to specify the interpretation for multiple ranges of values for each test type.

Infection Report: This option generates an aggregate infection report for a particular period for one or all Lab sections. It also provides an option to create a Word document of the generated report.
This is an editable page for setting the layout of the Patient Report, Daily log of Specimens and Daily log of Patients.
This is an editable page for creating custom worksheets.
This page gives a summary of the various users given access to the system.
It also allows for creation of new user accounts.
It allows to edit account settings, delete accounts and monitor account activity.
This page allows for the configuration of the patient registration page. It allows for creating mandatory fields and hides certain fields if they are not desired to be filled.
It also allows for creation of certain custom fields for Patient registration and new Specimen addition which may be needed by certain labs only.
This page allows to toggle between languages.
You can also choose to change the language for a few pages using this option. The pages are listed as a drop-down menu.
Click on the Setup Network option in the Lab Configuration tab.
You will now be able to access BLIS by clicking on BlisSetup.html and entering your username and password.
In case of a computer restart or network failure repeat above steps again.
This option gives the configuration summary for the entire system as a Microsoft Word document.
This option allows to take a backup of the entire system to prevent loss of data.
In case of system failure, if we want to revert to a previously backedup copy of the data we can use this option.
Gives a complete listing of the available test types.
We can use this page to edit existing present test types.
New test types can also be added using the Add New option located near the top of the Page.
Gives a complete listing of the available specimen types.
We can use this page to edit existing specimen types. Tests compatible with a particular specimen type can added/deleted by checking the appropriate boxes located here.
New specimen types can also be added using the Add New option located near the top of the Page.
This option takes a backup of the system and stores it on the local drive. This option is only available to the Admin.
This page allows us to register new patients or lookup existing patients based on name, patient ID or number.
Once a patient has been registered, we can use this page to view,edit the patients profile.
We can also register a specimen the patient has provided for a particular test.
This option allows us to add results for a particular patient based on the specimens he had provided.
This option allows us to add results for a particular Test Type.

This option allows us to verify the result based on the test type. It shows the list of results for all patients whose results have not been verified. You can modify the results and enter remarks before verifying the results.
This option generates a worksheet based on the Lab Section and Test Type. You can also use a custom worksheet which can be created by Admins using Lab Configuration > Tests > Reports > Worksheet.
You can create a blank worksheet by choosing the Keep Blank option and specifying the number of rows you need.
You can use this page to search for registered patients. Enter a partial name to generate a list of patients containing the string.
Once you select the patient, you can view the patient's profile, look up the tests he has undergone and the results of those tests.
This page displays the current item quantities in stock.
You can update stock as you acquire new items by adding the item name,quantity received, receiver name and remarks.
Patient Report: This option allows us to generate the report for a particular patient based on either, the patient name, patient number or patient id.

Daily Log: This option generates a daily of either patient or test records from a particular start date to end date. You can customize the kind of report you want by choosing one option from the Section (e.g. Serology, Hematology) and/or Test type (e.g. ALT/SGPT, HGB) dropdown menus.

Prevalence Rate: This report gives the prevalence of a particular infection type based on the number of tests done and the results. You can enter the specified period for which you want to check the prevalence rate of a particular infection. You can also views the Trends of the infection for the defined period, as a graph, by clicking the Trends option when the report is displayed.
Counts: This option generates a report for a particular period of time based on the count of tests, specimen or doctor statistics.

Turnaround Time: This option generates the turnaround time for all or chosen test for a particular period of time. It also generates a graph of the statistics. You can choose to include both pending and completed tests or just the completed tests.

Infection Report: This option generates an aggregate infection report for a particular period for one or all Lab sections. It also provides an option to create a Word document of the generated report.
Inventory: This option generates a listing of the current inventory.
